intro: Phyllanthus marojejiensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and smooth, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. It has a short stem with alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
